intro: Aspidogyne sumacoensis, commonly known as the Sumaco aspidogyne, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a climbing shrub characterized by its opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that splits open to release seeds. Aspidogyne sumacoensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
